p: Endophytic fungi are a diverse group of microorganisms that thrive asymptomatically in the healthy tissues of the host. Many of these endophytes are known to biosynthesis a plethora of bioactive secondary metabolites that may assist the host in protection and survival against pathogenic and insect attacks, stress tolerance and disease resistance [ 1, 2]. Moreover, some of these compounds have been proven to be useful as leads for novel drug discovery [ 3â€“ 5]. Thus, endophytes and their secondary metabolites not only play an important ecological role but also positively impact the field of medicine.
